1.text: Call now, if there is answering thee; and to whom from the holy ones wilt thou turn?

2.text: For to the foolish, and anger will slay, and the simple will jealousy kill.

3.text: I saw the foolish one taking root, and suddenly I shall curse his habitation.

4.text: His sons shall be far from salvation, and they shall be crushed in the gate, and none delivering.

5.text: Which his harvest the hungry one will devour, and not from thorns shall they take it, and destruction gaped after their substance.

6.text: For toil will not come forth from the dust, and labor will not spring up from the earth;

7.text: For man shall be born to labor as the sons of the flame will lift up to fly.

8.text: But I will seek to God, and to God set my cause:

9.text: He did great things, and no searching; and wonders even no number:

10.text: He gave rain upon the face of the earth, and sent waters upon the out places:

11.text: To raise up the humbled to height; and those mourning were exalted to salvation.

12.text: Bringing to nought the purposes of the crafty, and their hand shall not do an undertaking.

13.text: He took the wise in their craftiness, and the counsel of the perverse was headlong.

14.text: The days they will meet darkness, and they will grope in the noon day as night.

15.text: And he saved the needy from the sword, from their mouth and from the band of the strong one.

16.text: And hope will be to the poor one, and iniquity contracted her mouth.

17.text: Behold, happy the man God shall rebuke him: and thou shalt not reject the correction of the Almighty:

18.text: For he will cause pain, and he will bind up: he will smite and his hands will heal.

19.text: In six straits he will deliver thee, and in seven, evil shall not touch upon thee.

20.text: In famine he redeemed thee from death, and in war from the hands of the sword.

21.text: In the scourge of the tongue thou shalt be hid, and thou shalt not be afraid of desolation when it shall come.

22.text: At desolation and at hunger thou shalt laugh, and from the beasts of the earth thou shalt not fear.

23.text: For with the stones of the field they covenant, and the beast of the field was at peace with thee.

24.text: And thou knewest that thy tent is peace, and thou reviewedst thy dwelling, and thou shalt not sin.

25.text: And thou knewest the multitude of thy seed, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.

26.text: Thou shalt come in old age to thy grave, as the ascending of a heap of sheaves in its time.

27.text: Behold this, we searched it out, so it is: hear it, and know thou for thyself.
